clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Imipenem is indicated in combination with cilastatin with or without relebactam for the treatment of bacterial infections including respiratory skin bone gynecologic urinary tract and intra abdominal as well as septicemia and endocarditis L7526 L7568

contraindications.disease: In case of overdose with the combination product including relebactam and cilastatin it is recommended to provide supportive care L7568 Imipenem cilastatin and relebactam may be removed via hemodialysis
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Imipenem is a beta lactam antibiotic belongings to the subgroup of carbapenems L7526 L7568 Imipenem is active against aerobic and anaerobic Gram positive as well as Gram negative bacteria including i Pseudomonas aeruginosa i and the i Enterococcus i It exerts a bactericidal effects by disrupting cell wall synthesis

incompatibilities.description: Cyclosporine may increase the neurotoxic activities of Imipenem
The risk or severity of generalized seizure can be increased when Ganciclovir is combined with Imipenem
The risk or severity of generalized seizure can be increased when Valganciclovir is combined with Imipenem
The serum concentration of Imipenem can be increased when it is combined with Probenecid
The therapeutic efficacy of Valproic acid can be decreased when used in combination with Imipenem
The therapeutic efficacy of BCG vaccine can be decreased when used in combination with Imipenem
The therapeutic efficacy of Typhoid vaccine can be decreased when used in combination with Imipenem
